learning_outcomes.description: Compare and contrast literature on a specific topic and critically analyse its merits;
Synthesise an annotated bibliography and create a literature review;
Explain your work and enhance your verbal and written presentation skills;
Describe the application of research ethics and integrity in different situations;
Appraise the process through which research findings can move towards commercialisation and social impact;
Explain and communicate ideas in a classroom context.

assessments.assessment_title: Active participation in applied class activities
assessments.due_date:
Week 2 Mon - Week 13 Fri

Participation material is due at the end of your scheduled contact session.

Your mark will be based on the best 6 out of 9 applied classes.

This will accommodate unforeseen circumstances such as illness or technical issues.
assessments.task_description:
For each of the 10 applied classes, a maximum of 10 marks can be earned through active class participation.

Applied class activities can be in the form of discussions, presentations, surveys and other in-class activities.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person.

When written material needs to be submitted, this is due by the end of each applied class. To accommodate unforeseen circumstances such as illness or technical issues, your mark will be based on the best 6 out of 9 applied classes.

Feedback to students: Students will have an opportunity to receive feedback prior to Census (Week 6). 

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Assignments are research tasks based on the applied classes and lecture materials and journals. Assignment 1 focuses on research integrity, plagiarism in research, and ethics.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

This assessment can be assessed by two or more examiners in which case a post-marking moderation process will be applied.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
15/05/2026 10:00 am

Students give their oral presentations in their regular applied class time in weeks 12 and 13.

Any content required for the presentation needs to be uploaded by the due date.
assessments.task_description:
Assignment 2 will be conducted in the form of an oral presentation to be held in Weeks 12 and 13. Any content required for the presentation (e.g slides) needs to be uploaded by the due date. The oral presentation will be based on the selected small research topic and is to be completed in-person.

In accordance with UQ Assessment Policy, your presentation will be recorded.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

This assessment can be assessed by two or more examiners in which case a post-marking moderation process will be applied.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This will be the end-of-semester exam covering all the components taught in Weeks 1 - 13.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
